intro: Ardisia amplifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green, broad leaves and produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels. Following flowering, it develops bright red berries that are attractive to birds and other wildlife. Ardisia amplifolia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
